Class Strike

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • Event
        • Strike
  • public class Strike
extends Event
    During the Strike event, all workers will stop working and all item production will be stopped. At the end of the Strike, most of the workers will leave. Only one worker will be left per station.
    Version:
    November 2022

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Event

        Badstock, duration, eventTimer, flashAdded, gf, Goodstock, left, maxSpeed, newSpeedLeft, newSpeedRight, newValueLeft, newValueRight, rf, right, slowSpeedLeft, slowSpeedRight

      Strike​(int d, boolean left, boolean right)
      Constructor for Strike

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void act()
      Sets the strikestatus, stops the machines, then starts the machines if the event is over, resets the strikeStatuses, workers are set to 1 per station, and endEvent() is called from the superclass.
      void startMachines()
      Starts machines on either the left or right side/sets produce speed to the speed the machines were last set to before they were set to 0.
      void stopMachines()
      Stops machines on either the left or right side/sets produce speed to 0.

        Sets instance variables

        d - Duration of the event
        left - If the event is on the left side of the screen
